head.title: seminar 2009-11-30: new metadata formats@kb.dk

ul.li: images 0 why are there so few of our images in google images?

div.h2: More exactly, we've at least six problems

ol.li: images 10 well, we didn't adhere to the architecture of the world wide web

ul.li: images 3 the bibliographic record is the single most important intellectual dissemination tool
images 4 library users should be able to find identify select and optain access to information resources
images 5 users use the library catalog
images 6 traditionally the information has been obtained in books
images 7 books are retrieved at the circulation desk

images 11
we have relied on the library catalog for dissemination
most metadata have not been available on the web
images 8 in general, users want the information not the medium

div.h2: electronic services doesn't look like the circulation desk
electronic services require higher granularity of description
div.p: traditionally the library has delivered whole books or journal volumes. That is just fine, if that's what the users ask for. however that is not in generally true, in particular if the requested information is on page 42
metadata is not just about the resource as a whole object a search and navigation system requires a content model describing its internal structure

ul.li: images 14 Guaman Poma de Ayala's family
images 15 mods and mets new metadata formats@kb.dk
images 16 mods is used in the COP family of services

div.p: metadata encoding & transmission standard, mets is a standard for structural metadata which is as useful for search and navigation system requires as for logical description of complex objects for digital preservation
metadata object description schema mods is a standard for bibliographic metadata with similar features as MARC but more expressive as regards relations between objects
